SENT.plain: A 30-year-old homosexual man presented with widespread Burkitt's lymphoma
On the basis of immunologic and viral studies, he was suspected of having the acquired immune deficiency syndrome
Following chemotherapy that included intrathecal cytosine arabinoside and methotrexate, brain stem edema, paraplegia, and an elevated cerebrospinal fluid level of myelin basic protein developed
Autopsy revealed vacuolar demyelination of spinal cord, brain stem, and cerebellum
The pathologic findings were similar to those reported to occur in myelopathy associated with intrathecal chemotherapy, but far more extensive
The contribution of the suspected acquired immune deficiency syndrome is unknown
